description: 1 photographic print : gelatin silver ; sheet 35.3 x 27.8 cm (13 7/8 x 10 15/16 in.) | Photograph shows Bessie Smith a female, African American blues singer holding feathers.

medium: 1 photographic print : gelatin silver ; sheet 35.3 x 27.8 cm (13 7/8 x 10 15/16 in.)
mediums: 1 photographic print : gelatin silver ; sheet 35.3 x 27.8 cm (13 7/8 x 10 15/16 in.)
notes: Title derived from information on verso of photographic print.
Forms part of: Portrait photographs of celebrities, a LOT which in turn forms part of the Carl Van Vechten photograph collection (Library of Congress).
Exhibited in: Jazz Century, Museo di Arte Moderna e Contemporanea ..., Italy, 2008-2009.

Exhibited in: "Jazz Singers" at the Performing Arts Reading Room, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C., Feb. - July 2016; Library's Gershwin Gallery, Walt Disney Concert Hall, Los Angeles, Calif., Aug. 2016 - Feb. 2017.
Exhibited: "The Harlem Renaissance and Trans-Atlantic Modernism" at The Metropolitan Museum of Art, 1000 Fifth Avenue, New York, NY 10028, February 20, 2024 - July 28, 2024.

rights:
The Library of Congress does not own rights to material in its collections. Therefore, it does not license or charge permission fees for use of such material and cannot grant or deny permission to publish or otherwise distribute the material.

Ultimately, it is the researcher's obligation to assess copyright or other use restrictions and obtain permission from third parties when necessary before publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the Library's collections.

For information about reproducing, publishing, and citing material from this collection, as well as access to the original items, see: Carl Van Vechten Photographs - Rights and Restrictions Information
